answers.answer: Hi!Bleeding from umbilicus or navel or belly button could be due to fistula, boil, infection. Umbilical fistulas are narrow tubes connecting the outer or skin with anything inside like intestine, mesentry etc. Boils in the umbilicus can also burst and release blood and pus.  .  Do consult your doctor. A swab test of the sticky discharge should be done and culture and sensitivity tested to start appropriate treatment. Diabetes should be tested for as this may cause infection to linger. At times colored X-rays are taken after injecting dye to know if there is a fistula. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: Hi, I have my belly pierced for about a month I've always had a slimy substance come out of my piercing after I shower but this time it's read & I can't take it out please help!
title: Belly piercing
